data.title: I am committed to quit!
data.description: This award is achieved when you start the quitting process.

data.title: I am quitting!
data.description: This award is obtained when you reach your particular quit date and begin the quitting process.

data.title: Smoke-Free Day
data.description: This award is obtained when you have been smoke-free for a complete day.

data.title: Smoke-Free Week
data.description: This award is obtained when you have been smoke-free for an enitre week.

data.title: 21 Day Challenge
data.description: This award is obtained when you reach the 21 day mark of your quitting process and break the habit.

data.title: Smoke-Free Month
data.description: This award is obtained when you have been smoke-free for an enitre month.

data.title: 100 Cigarettes not smoked
data.description: This award is obtained when you reach 100 cigarettes not smoked.

data.title: 250 Cigarettes not smoked
data.description: This award is obtained when you reach 250 cigarettes not smoked.

data.title: 500 Cigarettes not smoked
data.description: This award is obtained when you reach 500 cigarettes not smoked.

data.title: Keep track of smoking
data.description: This award is obtained when you keep track of your smoking habit for 3 days in a row.

data.title: Keep track of cravings
data.description: This award is obtained when you keep track of your cravings for 3 days in a row.

data.title: $100 Saved!
data.description: This award is obtained when you reach $100 not spent on cigarettes.

data.title: $500 Saved!
data.description: This award is obtained when you reach $500 not spent on cigarettes.

data.title: $1000 Saved!
data.description: This award is obtained when you reach $1000 not spent on cigarettes.

data.title: Lung capacity has increased
data.description: 72 hours after quitting your lung capacity has increased and your bronchial tubes have relaxed, making breathing easier.

data.title: Lung functioning has increased 30%
data.description: Three months after quitting your circulation has improved and your lung functioning has increased by up to 30%.

data.title: Carbon monoxide and oxygen levels return to normal
data.description: Eight hours after quitting, carbon monoxide levels have dropped in your body and oxygen level have returned to normal.

data.title: Coughing and shortness of breath improve
data.description: Six months after quitting your coughin, sinus congestion, tiredness and shortness of breath have improved.

data.title: Nicotine levels reduced to zero
data.description: Two weeks after quitting all nicotine has left your body.

data.title: Sense of taste and smell have improved.
data.description: 48 hours after quitting your sense of taste and smell have improved.

data.title: Change of having a heart attack has started to go down
data.description: 48 hours after quitting your chances of having a hear attack have started to go down.

data.title: Risk of heart attack cut in half
data.description: One year after quitting your risk of a smoking related heart attack has been cut in half.

data.title: Night Out Challenge
data.description: This award is obtained when you go for a night out and record zero cigarettes smoked.
